news_header: An Israeli female soldier, Agam Berger, has reportedly returned to Israel as Hamas begins to release Israeli hostages.
news_text: Agam Berger, an Israeli female soldier, has reportedly made it back to Israel as Hamas starts handing over Israeli hostages. Live footage shows two Israeli soldiers, one male and one female, during the handover. Berger was previously handed over to the Red Cross in North Gaza. The Palestinian Islamic Jihad has released videos of two Israeli hostages, Gadi Moses and Arbel Yehud, who were to be released as part of a ceasefire agreement. Yehud is noted as the last surviving civilian woman held hostage. Currently, five hostages remain in Thailand, and Hamas has released seven hostages in exchange for 290 prisoners from Israel. Israel plans to release 110 prisoners in return for three Israelis. A second release of hostages is expected on Saturday.
